english.segment1: Im the sadist that reminds you of your blessing, And the reaper that takes them away. To a place where they can lay there, And wilt and rot away.
english.segment2: And this cells just as cold as you left it, And Im scratching the walls to escape it.
english.segment3: Leave it to the Cannibal now. Feed him whats left of us, the rest of us. Leave it to the Cannibal now. Feed him whats left of us. The Cunning wins again.
english.segment4: Im the glorified liar sending you sentiment, And then posing as the innocent. You dont know about ignorance or pain, But you said you could take it away.
english.segment5: And this cells just as cold as you left it, And Im scratching the walls to escape it.
english.segment6: Leave it to the Cannibal now. Feed him whats left of us, the rest of us. Leave it to the Cannibal now. Feed him whats left of us. The Cunning wins again.
english.segment7: You call this inspiration. I call this a charade. Driven by institution. Hell-bent on cleaning the stain.
english.segment8: I should grab all these cannibals, lay them all in a straight line, And deny their requests for more, more, more.
english.segment9: Leave it to the Cannibal now. Feed him whats left of us, the rest of us. Leave it to the Cannibal now. Feed him whats left of us. The Cunning wins again.
